relevant_findings.general: Normal physical examination except for scars from thyroid surgery.

urinalysis.red_cells: 20 to 50 red cells per high-power field
urinalysis.sediment: Dysmorphic red cells and two cellular casts thought to be red-cell casts.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure decreased from 138/88 mm Hg to 100/60 mm Hg and 110/60 mm Hg.

renal_biopsy.findings: Glomeruli normal; focal, mild mesangial hypercellularity; thin glomerular basement membrane with segmental, scalloped zones; reduced Ig3 and Ig5 staining.
renal_biopsy.conclusion: Consistent with thin basement membrane nephropathy or a carrier state of X-linked Alportâ€™s syndrome.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained well with no evidence of progressive renal disease.
